# ASL Alphabet Hand Landmarks Dataset

High-quality 3D hand landmark coordinates for American Sign Language (A-Z) alphabet recognition, collected using Google MediaPipe.

## Dataset Overview

- **Total Samples:** 10,508
- **Classes:** 26 (A-Z)
- **Samples per class:** ~400 (balanced)
- **Format:** NumPy `.npy` files
- **Landmark model:** MediaPipe Hands (21 landmarks)
- **Coordinate system:** 3D (x, y, z)

## File Structure

```
landmarks/
├── A/ (404 samples)
├── B/ (400 samples)
├── C/ (403 samples)
... (26 total)
└── Z/ (403 samples)
```

## Data Format

Each `.npy` file contains a single hand gesture:

```python
import numpy as np
landmarks = np.load('landmarks/A/frame_001.npy')
print(landmarks.shape)  # (21, 3)
```

- **Shape:** `(21, 3)` - 21 hand landmarks with (x, y, z) coordinates
- **Normalization:** Position-invariant (centered at wrist landmark)
- **Scale:** Distance-normalized for hand size invariance

## MediaPipe Hand Landmarks

```
0: WRIST
1-4: THUMB (CMC, MCP, IP, TIP)
5-8: INDEX (MCP, PIP, DIP, TIP)
9-12: MIDDLE (MCP, PIP, DIP, TIP)
13-16: RING (MCP, PIP, DIP, TIP)
17-20: PINKY (MCP, PIP, DIP, TIP)
```

## Related Project

This dataset was collected for the [ASL&AI](https://github.com/borisgraudt/asl-ai) project, which achieves 97.2% accuracy on real-time ASL alphabet recognition.
